@graph.rdfs:label: PubLayNet: Large-Scale Automatic Annotation of Document Layout in PubMed Central Open Access Subset (Xu et al., 2020)

@graph.schema:name: PubMed Central Open Access Subset (downloaded 2018-10-03)
@graph.schema:description: Articles provided under Creative Commons, containing both PDF and NLM-JATS XML representations

@graph.rdfs:label: XML cleaning and standardization (remove math/formula nodes, move list/table/figure to floats-group)
PDF parsing with PDFMiner to extract textboxes, textlines, images, geometric shapes

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: Raw PDF layout primitives (textboxes, images, shapes) with bounding boxes

@graph.rdfs:label: Unicode KD normalization of all strings from XML and PDF
Fuzzy string matching (Levenshtein via fuzzysearch) + adaptive distance threshold + sequential textline matching

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: PDF elements matched to XML nodes with preliminary category labels

@graph.rdfs:label: Margin-based annotation of figure/table bodies using main-text box and caption position
Polygon segmentation generation from textlines (horizontal/vertical edges only) + reuse bbox for figures/tables
Annotation quality filtering (>99% coverage for non-title pages, >90% for title pages) + manual curation of dev/test

rdip:outputDataset.schema:name: PubLayNet dataset
rdip:outputDataset.schema:size: Training: 340,391 pages; Dev: 11,858 pages; Test: 11,983 pages (5 categories: Text, Title, List, Table, Figure)

@graph.rdfs:label: Journal-level stratified split + balanced sampling per category + manual curation of dev/test
